intro: Malapoenna hookeri, commonly known as the Hooker's malapoenna, is a flowering plant native to the Western Cape region of South Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, fragrant white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and often covered in fine hairs. Malapoenna hookeri is typically found in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to the Mediterranean climate of its native habitat.
